org.spongepowered.api.world.extent

Interface TileEntityVolume

  • All Superinterfaces:
    BlockVolume
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Chunk, Extent, World

    public interface TileEntityVolume
extends BlockVolume
    A block volume that also contains TileEntity instances.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Collection<TileEntity> getTileEntities()
      Return a collection of tile entities contained within this volume, possibly only returning tile entities only in loaded areas.
      Collection<TileEntity> getTileEntities(Predicate<TileEntity> filter)
      Return a collection of tile entities contained within this volume, possibly only returning tile entities only in loaded areas.
      Optional<TileEntity> getTileEntity(int x, int y, int z)
      Get the tile entity at the given position, if it exists.
      Optional<TileEntity> getTileEntity(Location blockLoc)
      Get the tile entity at the block in the given location, if it exists.
      Optional<TileEntity> getTileEntity(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position)
      Gets the tile entity at the given position, if it exists.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.spongepowered.api.world.extent.BlockVolume

        getBlock, getBlock, getBlockMax, getBlockMin, getBlockSize, setBlock, setBlock

    • Method Detail

      • getTileEntities

        Collection<TileEntity> getTileEntities()
        Return a collection of tile entities contained within this volume, possibly only returning tile entities only in loaded areas.

        For world implementations, only some parts of the world is usually loaded, so this method will only return tile entities within those loaded parts.

        Returns:
        A collection of entities

      • getTileEntities

        Collection<TileEntity> getTileEntities(Predicate<TileEntity> filter)
        Return a collection of tile entities contained within this volume, possibly only returning tile entities only in loaded areas. The returned tile entities are filtered by the given Predicate before being returned.

        For world implementations, only some parts of the world is usually loaded, so this method will only return tile entities within those loaded parts.

        Parameters:
        filter - The filter to apply to the returned entities
        Returns:
        A collection of filtered entities

      • getTileEntity

        Optional<TileEntity> getTileEntity(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position)
        Gets the tile entity at the given position, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        position - The position
        Returns:
        The tile entity, or Optional.absent()

      • getTileEntity

        Optional<TileEntity> getTileEntity(int x,
                                   int y,
                                   int z)
        Get the tile entity at the given position, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        x - The X position
        y - The Y position
        z - The Z position
        Returns:
        The tile entity, or Optional.absent()

      • getTileEntity

        Optional<TileEntity> getTileEntity(Location blockLoc)
        Get the tile entity at the block in the given location, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        blockLoc - The block position
        Returns:
        The tile entity, or Optional.absent()
